meanings.definition: A group of people working together, especially in a manual or unskilled job.
meanings.sent1: The cuadrilla of workers quickly finished the construction project.
meanings.sent2: The cuadrilla gathered to clean up the park together.
meanings.sent3: The cuadrilla decided to race each other with their tools for fun.
meanings.sent4: The cuadrilla of ants worked tirelessly to build their nest.
meanings.sent5: The cuadrilla of students painted the classroom walls with precision.

meanings.definition: A group of friends or associates.
meanings.sent1: My cuadrilla and I always go hiking on weekends.
meanings.sent2: She invited her cuadrilla to celebrate her birthday at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The cuadrilla planned a surprise party for their friend.
meanings.sent4: Their cuadrilla supported each other through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The cuadrilla enjoyed a picnic in the park together.

meanings.definition: A group of musicians or dancers performing together.
meanings.sent1: The cuadrilla of musicians played beautiful melodies at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The dance cuadrilla impressed the audience with their synchronized moves.
meanings.sent3: The cuadrilla of dancers accidentally bumped into each other during practice.
meanings.sent4: The cuadrilla of musicians harmonized perfectly during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The cuadrilla of dancers twirled gracefully on stage.
